snippet: Allah-ade Jenkins, who served over 21 years in prison for attempted armed robbery, has had difficulty finding employment. But he has established two clothing labels that draw inspiration from his African-American heritage.
abstract: The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund gives $266 to Allah-ade Jenkins to purchase a sewing machine.
lead_paragraph: Allah-ade Jenkins, who served over 21 years in prison for attempted armed robbery, has had difficulty finding employment. But he has established two clothing labels that draw inspiration from his African-American heritage.

headline.print_headline: Looking Beyond Criminal Past, a Tailor Connects With His Roots
headline.main: A Tailor Looks Beyond His Criminal Past by Connecting With His Roots

keywords.name: organizations
